instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard not working after trying a bad FAN
threads.message:
The fan was making a noise, Replaced with an old one, I think the replaced fan had an internal short, I immediately removed the bad FAN, Replaced it with a new one... Now the keyboard is not working anymore... Rest all fine...
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_KBD</SIGNAL> - 3.4 11V   
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_KBD</SIGNAL> - 5.1 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_KBD</SIGNAL> - 3.3V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard not working after trying a bad FAN
threads.message:
More likely broken trace, or knocked off components.
Check what you could damage in the replacement process.
Even using same connector, fan and keyboard lines are completely separated.
Inspect flex and KB connectors too.

Trackpad still working good?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard not working after trying a bad FAN
threads.message: Yes trackpad is working good , fan also working, I can see that the apple logo stays more than usual time before boot up

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard not working after trying a bad FAN
threads.message:
Recheck all the things you've touched when changed the fan first time.
Clean the connectors and inspect the pins.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard not working after trying a bad FAN
threads.message:
The connector was bad , tried to change the connector . It was a very temperature sensitive part , I have spoiled more PCB pads... Apparently I have stopped working on this particular logic board and replaced it with another one....

Now I have a different problem..

Board brightness is keep changing... Like heartbeat every second brightness is increasing and the decreases...
Please find the video :
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/10Ia6Sq0CeH9MFBkmIE-rFhPSS-MbJTrr[/URL]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard not working after trying a bad FAN
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard not working after trying a bad FAN
threads.message:
Is this different board?
Did you test with known good LCD assembly?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard not working after trying a bad FAN
threads.message: Yes its a different board, I only have an LCD that is compatible with <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, Nothing for <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard not working after trying a bad FAN
threads.message: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/7 LCD assembly can be used for test on <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>; vice versa is valid too.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard not working after trying a bad FAN
threads.message: The problem simply solved by disconnecting the LCD connector and connected again...
